record.jsxtip: Fires after the user double-clicks a list item or presses the Enter key with focus in a record of this list.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the CDF jsxid of the selected record. When more than one record is executed, this variable is set to just one of the executed records. Use strRECORDIDS when the list is multi-select.

record.jsxtip: Fires after the user selects a record.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the CDF jsxid of the selected record, null if a deselection event.

record.jsxtip: Fires after the user changes the selected records.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.

record.jsxtip: Fires when the user drags a record of this list. Canceling this event prevents the drag from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the type of drag (JSXDragType).
the CDF jsxid of the record to be dragged.
the HTML element acted upon.
the CDF jsxid of the record to be dragged, same as strDRAGID.
the index of the column where the drag begins.

record.jsxtip: Fires after the user drops a record on this list. Canceling this event prevents the CDF adoption from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the object where the drag begins.
the type of drag (JSXDragType).
the CDF jsxid of the dragged record.
the CDF jsxid of the record that receives the drop.
the index of the column that receives the drop.
whether the source of the dragged CDF record allows the adoption.
Ctrl Drop
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user drops a record on this list while pressing the Ctrl key. Canceling this event prevents the CDF adoption from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the object where the drag begins.
the type of drag (JSXDragType).
the CDF jsxid of the dragged record.
an array containing the CDF jsxids of the dragged records.
the CDF jsxid of the record that receives the drop.
the index of the column that receives the drop
whether the source of the dragged CDF record allows the adoption.

record.jsxtip: Fires before a record from this list is adopted by another object. Canceling this event prevents the CDF adoption from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the CDF jsxid of the record to adopt.
the object that will adopt the record(s).
true if Ctrl Drop, false otherwise.

record.jsxtip: Fires after the user hovers the mouse over this list and before the spyglass displays. The event script must evaluate to the HTML content to display in the spyglass. Canceling this event prevents the spyglass from displaying.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
CDF jsxid of the spied record
the index of the column that receives the spy action

record.jsxtip: Fires after the user right-clicks this list and before the bound context menu displays. Canceling this event prevents the menu from displaying.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the CDF jsxid of the selected record.
the index of the column that receives the menu action.

record.jsxreturntext: use this field to override the default menu with an instance of jsx3.gui.Menu.
record.jsxtext: the menu to display.
Before Sort
record.jsxtip: Fires when the user clicks on the header cell of a sortable column in this list and before the records are sorted. Canceling this event prevents the sort from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.

record.jsxreturntext: use this field to sort on a column other than the one that the user clicked on.
record.jsxtext: the index of the clicked column.
After Sort
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user sorts this list.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the index of the column that this list is sorted on.
Before Resize
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user releases the mouse after resizing a column of this list and before the resize is committed. Canceling this event prevents the resizing from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the column of the list to be resized.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the index of the column being resized.
After Resize
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user resizes a column. Canceling this event prevents the resizing from occurring.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the index of the column being resized.
the pixel difference in width.
the old width for the column.

record.jsxreturntext: use this field to set the resulting column width to a value other than the width at which the user released the mouse.
record.jsxtext: the width for the column in implied pixels or percentage.
Before Append
record.jsxtip: Fires when the user adds a new CDF record and before the change is committed.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the CDF record to append as a JavaScript object.
After Append
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user adds a new CDF record and HTML table record (TR).

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the CDF record to append as a JavaScript object.
the native HTML object reference to the new element.
After Edit
record.jsxtip: Fires after the user finishes an edit session and before an edit is committed.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the browser event that triggers this event.
the CDF jsxid of the selected record.
the CDF attribute name without the leading @ symbol.
the CDF attribute value.
the handle to edit the mask instance.
the HTML Table cell (TD) in the view.

record.jsxtip: Fires after this list is removed from the DOM.

record.jsxtext: the object that publishes this event.
the parent of this list before it is removed from the DOM.
